tldr: Affected versions of the package are vulnerable to a crash due to improper handling of malformed HTTP/2 HEADERS frames containing oversized or invalid HPACK data. Such input can trigger an unhandled `TLSSocket` `ECONNRESET` error, causing the Node.js process to terminate instead of safely closing the connection, enabling a remote denial-of-service condition, particularly in applications without explicit secure socket error handlers.
doest_this_affect_me: You are affected if you are using a version that falls within the vulnerable range.
how_to_fix: Upgrade the `node` library to a patch version.
